response.answer_text: Before understanding the reason of conflict, we should first look at the map of the region :  This conflict is known as Nagorno-Karabakh Conflict. It is a territorial and ethnic conflict between Armenia and Azerbaijan over the disputed region of Nagorno-Karabakh and seven surrounding districts, which are controlled by Armenia in reality but are internationally recognized as part of Azerbaijan. REASONS OF DISPUTE :- 1 ) ETHINICITY AND TERRITORY : Nagorno-Karabakh region has 95% of the population as ethnically Armenian and is controlled by them but it is internationally recognised as part of Azerbaijan. 2 ) RELIGIOUS PROBLEM : while Azerbaijan is Muslim majority country, whereas Armenia is Christian majority. 3 ) VESTED POLITICAL INTREST : this is self explanatory as Domestic political compulsion compels political leaders of both the nation's to raise and use the issue time and again for their own advantage. Brief History Of Conflict:- In 1920 Nagorno-Karabakh Autonomous Region was established within Azerbaijan by the then Soviet Union.  However in 1988 the legislature of Nagorno-Karabakh region passed a passed a resolution to join Armenia despite the region's legal location within Azerbaijan’s borders. In 1991 War erupted between Armenia and Azerbaijan over the region(when Nagorno-Karabakh region declared that it will not join any of the two countries), leaving roughly tens of thousands of casualties and hundreds of thousands of refugee. In 1994 Russia mediated a ceasefire which was in place since then. In 2016 there was a bloody 40 days war which resulted in heavy casualities on both sides. Apart from these 1000s of people have died in regular ceasefire violations. IMPACT OF THE CONFLICT: 1 ) ECONOMIC IMPACT :- This could also disrupt oil and gas exports from the region, since Azerbaijan, is a significant oil and gas exporter to Europe and Central Asia. This may even lead to higher oil prices globally. 2 ) INTERNATIONAL ACTORS MAY COME INTO THE PLAY :- Russia has closer ties with Armenia while Turkey and USA support Azerbaijan, and Iran has a large Azeri minority, which could escalate a crisis and entangle actors involved. Any military escalation would draw regional powers like Turkey and Russia more deeply into the conflict. 3 ) DESTABILIZES THE REGION :- military conflict between the countries and destabilize the South Caucasus region.
